mlp

Class FeatureSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • mlp.FeatureSet

  • public class FeatureSet
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a set of related features. Many math elements can possess alternative FeatureSet's. A feature is a (name,values) pair. Note the "plural" nature of values: a feature can have one or more alternative (String) values; those alternative values are grouped together into a set. A feature set can have a name (a string), but that is optional.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FeatureSet

        public FeatureSet(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String>> map)
        Constructs an unnamed feature set object, where the feature name-values pairs are in the specified input map.
        Parameters:
        map - a map of name-values pairs, where each entry corresponds to a separate feature. The name in each entry is the name of a feature. The value part of the entry is a sorted set of alternative (String) values that that feature can have.

      • FeatureSet

        public FeatureSet(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String>> map,
                  java.lang.String featureSetName)
        Constructs a named feature set object, where the feature name-values pairs are in the specified input map.
        Parameters:
        map - a map of name-values pairs, where each entry corresponds to a separate feature. The name in each entry is the name of a feature. The value part of the entry is a sorted set of alternative (String) values that that feature can have.
        featureSetName - the name of the feature set being constructed.

        Parameters:

      • getFeature

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setFeature

        public boolean setFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                          java.lang.String featureValues,
                          java.lang.String separator)
        If there is already a feature whose key is the specified featureName, then that feature entry is removed and replaced with the new specified feature. Otherwise, the specified feature is added to this FeatureSet object. The specified featureValues is a String of separator-separated set of elements; that string is split along the specified separator into a SortedSet of individual String values. It is this set of alternative individual Strings that collectively constitute the formal value of the feature. If the specified separator is null, then no separation is assumed, and thus the feature has just one value (no alternatives).
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added.
        featureValues - a concatenated, separator-separated String of individual elements that will make up the set that is the value of the specified feature.
        separator - a string marker that separates the various elements that make up the value of the specified feature. The separator can be "|", ";", or anything unique that would not normally occur within a single element. If null, then no separation is assumed.
        Returns:
        true if the specified feature is successfully set.

      • setFeature

        public boolean setFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> featureValues)
        If there is already a feature whose key is the specified featureName, then that feature entry is removed and replaced with the new specified feature. Otherwise, the specified feature is added to this FeatureSet object.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added.
        featureValues - the collection of alternative values of the specified feature.
        Returns:
        true if the specified feature is successfully set.

      • addFeature

        public boolean addFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                          java.lang.String featureValues,
                          java.lang.String separator)
        Adds a (name,values) feature to this FeatureSet object. If the specified feature name is not already a feature of the underlying object, then this method adds this feature (name,values) pair. Otherwise, the specified values are "merged" into the existing value of the feature. Note that the specified featureValues is a String of zero or more values, separated by the specified separator; that string is split along the specified separator into a SortedSet of individual (String) values. It is this set of alternative individual Strings that collectively constitutes the (formal) value of the feature. This set is either union-ed to the existing set-value or added as is, depending on whether the specified feature is already a feature of the underlying object or not. If the specified separator is null, then the feature value is assumed to be a single String, namely, the whole specified featureValue.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added, e.g., Role, Areas (of math where the pertaining symbol is used), Attributes, ...
        featureValues - a String of alternative individual elements (separated by the specified separator if the latter is not null) that will make up the set of alternative values of the specified feature.
        separator - a string marker that separates the various elements that make up the value of the specified feature. The separator can be "||", ";", or anything unique that would not normally occur within a single element. If null, then no separation is assumed.
        Returns:
        true if the specified feature name is not already a feature of the underlying object, or if new feature value elements are successfully combined with the set-value of the specified feature name.

      • addFeature

        public boolean addFeature(java.lang.String featureName,
                          java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> featureValues)
        Adds a (name,values) feature to this FeatureSet object. If the specified feature name is not already a feature of the underlying object, then this method adds this feature (name,values) pair. Otherwise, the specified values is union-ed into the existing set of alternative value of the feature.
        Parameters:
        featureName - the name of the feature to be added, e.g., Role, Areas (of math where the pertaining symbol is used), Attributes, ...
        featureValues - a collection of alternative String values of the specified feature.
        Returns:
        true if the specified feature name is not already a feature of the underlying object, or if the new feature value elements are successfully combined with the set-value of the specified feature name.

        Parameters:

        Indicates whether this feature set has a name. Same as hasName().

        Returns:

      • changeFeatureName

        public boolean changeFeatureName(java.lang.String oldname,
                                 java.lang.String newname)
        Changes the current name of the specified feature to a new name, if the specified feature exists and the provided new name is not already a name of an existing feature.
        Parameters:
        oldname - the name of an existing feature whose name is requested to be changed by this method
        newname - the new name of the feature
        Returns:
        true if the name change was valid and done successfully; otherwise, it returns false.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(FeatureSet guest)
        Checks if the underlying FeatureSet object contains the specified featureSet object. A FeatureSet F1 is said to contain another FeatureSet F2 if for every (featureName2,featureValueSet2) pair in F2, "featureName2" is equal to a "featureName1" in F1, and featureValueSet2 is a subset of the featureValueSet1 corresponding to featureName1 in F1.
        Parameters:
        guest - the featureSet object to be checked for containment in the underlying FeatireSet object.
        Returns:
        true if the underlying FeatureSet object contains the specified featureSet object. Otherwise, it returns false.

      • isSubsetOf

        public boolean isSubsetOf(FeatureSet guest)
        Checks if the underlying FeatureSet object is contained in the specified featureSet object. A FeatureSet F1 is said to contain another FeatureSet F2 if for every (featureName2,featureValueSet2) pair in F2, "featureName2" is equal to a "featureName1" in F1, and featureValueSet2 is a subset of the featureValueSet1 corresponding to featureName1 in F1.
        Parameters:
        guest - the featureSet object to be checked for containing the underlying FeatureSet object.
        Returns:
        true if the underlying FeatureSet object is contained in the specified featureSet object. Otherwise, it returns false.

      • isSubsetOf

        public boolean isSubsetOf(java.util.Collection<FeatureSet> featureSets)
        Checks if the underlying FeatureSet object is contained in at least one of the FestureSet objects in the specified collection. A FeatureSet F1 is said to be a subset of (or contained in) another FeatureSet F2 if for every (featureName1,featureValueSet1) pair in F1, "featureName1" is equal to a "featureName2" in F2, and featureValueSet1 is a subset of the featureValueSet2 corresponding to featureName2 in F2.
        Parameters:
        featureSets - the Collection of FeatureSet objects to be checked to see if it has at least one FeatureSet object that contains this FeatureSet object
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the member FeatureSet objects of the specified collection contains this FeatureSet, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String offset)
        Turns this FeatureSet object to a String in the form of: Feature Set: [Feature Set name if it exists] offset feature-name: feature-value(s); ... offset feature-name: feature-value(s); Note that if a feature-value is a list of several Strings, those strings are converted first into a single String of ||-separated strings, and then made as the feature value.
        Parameters:
        offset - the leading offset of each feature. Typically a number of spaces/tabs.
        Returns:
        The string that the FeatureSet object is turned into.

      • printfs

        public void printfs(java.lang.String offset)
        Turns this FeatureSet object to a String by calling toString(offset), and prints it out.
        Parameters:
        offset - the leading offset of each feature. Typically a number of spaces/tabs.
